Job Details

New ideas are all around us, but only a few will change the world. That’s our focus at JPL. We ask the biggest questions, then search the universe for answers—literally. We build upon ideas that have guided generations, then share our discoveries to inspire generations to come. Your mission—your opportunity—is to seek out the answers that bring us one step closer. If you’re driven to discover, create, and inspire something that lasts a lifetime and beyond, you’re ready for JPL.

Located in Pasadena, California, JPL has a campus-like environment situated on 177 acres in the foothills of the San Gabriel Mountains and offers a work environment unlike any other: we inspire passion, foster innovation, build collaboration, and reward excellence.

Responsibilities:

The Optics Section provides world-leading capability and expertise in a wide range of technologies that are critical to the development of optical instruments. Section leadership and expertise are specifically applied to the development of advanced ground and space-based optical systems in the following areas: research and development of optics-related technologies; system architecture and concept definition; detailed optical system design, opto-mechanical design, analysis, and implementation; and alignment, test, and calibration of optical instruments and systems.

We invite you to join the Optics Section within the Wavefront Sensing and Control Group  to serve as an Optical Engineer IV. You will be reporting administratively to the Group Supervisor of the Group.

The Wavefront Sensing and Control Group develops active wavefront sensing and control and optical metrology architectures for large-aperture space and ground-based telescopes. In addition, the group develops wavefront control system testbeds for technology validation.  Finally, they develop active optical system architectures and perform integrated modeling and systems engineering for space telescopes.

We seek an engineer to support performance analysis and image processing chains for the development of various large aperture optical systems. 

This includes:

  • End-to-end image chain analysis and performance modeling of complex optical systems for Visible, IR, and UV including spectroscopy

  • Development and maintenance of performance error budgets capturing sources from fabrication, assembly, and environments

Qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Optics, Physics, or Electrical Engineering with 9 years of related experience, or Masters with 7 years of related experience, or PhD with 5 years of related experience

  • Experience with image-based methods and deconvolution including time-series exploitation

  • Hands-on experience and practical advanced knowledge in hardware integration and state-of-the-art measurement techniques

  • Experience developing optical systems from a concept through delivery, commissioning, and  operations

  • Extensive understanding of fundamental principles, theories, and concepts with applications to optical systems including Fourier optics

  • Extensive experience with Python and/or MATLAB

  • Experience leading a multifunctional and/or multidisciplinary team for a project within scope of assigned responsibility.

Preferred Skills

  • Significant expertise working with optical instruments such as wavefront control systems, telescopes, imagers, spectrometers, and interferometers

  • Experience with CodeV or other optical design tools

  • Experience with software Continuous Integration including best practices using configuration management

  • Working knowledge of analyzing optics metrics such at OTF, MTF, and image sharpness

Note: Must have an active Top Secret clearance based on a Single Scope Background Investigation (SSBI) within the last five years and be approved for Sensitive Compartmented Information (SCI) access.

JPL has a catalog of benefits and perks that span from the traditional to the unique. This includes a variety of health, dental, vision, wellbeing, and retirement plans, paid time off, learning, rideshare, childcare, flexible schedule, parental leave and many more. Our focus is on work-life balance, and living healthy, fulfilling lives as we Dare Mighty Things Together. For benefits eligible positions, benefits are effective the first day of the month coincident with or immediately following the employee’s start date.

For further benefits information click Benefits and Perks
